p: Projects such as the “Roll Back Malaria Partnership” (RBM) must invest approximately 93 billion euros until 2030 ( www.rollbackmalaria.org) for the treatment and total eradication of malaria. However, the success of such initiatives can be compromised once again by problems caused by the resistance of Plasmodium lineages. For this reason, research for the development of new antimalarial drugs must be constant. Recently, metal-based drugs have been actively explored for the treatment of a variety of parasites, with an important effect in the treatment of malaria. The following paragraphs aim to present the state-of-the-art of such strategy.
